shows.title: The People Vs Tech
shows.desc:
Tech has radically changed the way we live our lives. But with our fragile political systems threatened by this digital revolution, what do these changes – and the likes of Cambridge Analytica – mean for our democracy? Before democracy joins feudalism, supreme monarchies and communism as just another political experiment that quietly disappeared, what can we do to save the day?

Best-selling writer Jamie Bartlett founded the Centre for the Analysis of Social Media at the think-tank Demos and specialises in online social movements and the impact of technology on society.

shows.title: Hanging Out With The Outsiders
shows.desc:
For two years, Jamie Bartlett went undercover with some of our most radical political outsiders. Immersed with with the likes of Tommy Robinson, green militants, radical futurists and free love advocates (among others), he wanted to get behind the theories about radicalisation and understand the individuals caught up in and leading these new movements. What did he learn?

Best-selling writer Jamie Bartlett founded the Centre for the Analysis of Social Media at the think-tank Demos and specialises in online social movements and the impact of technology on society.
